controller.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientOrServer, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, ClientOrServer
    Server class. Is runnable, so that a thread can constantly execute server functions next to other functionality. This handles all serverside handling of incoming clients
    Author:
    Bit 4 - Group 4

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(java.lang.String arg)
        Server constructor. Starts a ServerSocket on port 4000. Starts a thread on itself (See run method). Starts a thread on TerminalInputHandler. Starts a new Room object with index 0, which is the "lobby". Checks the arguments. If the server was started as part of a singleplayer game, its print statements are silenced.
        Parameters:
        arg - Arguments for starting server, such as "singleplayer"
        See Also:
        TerminalInputHandler

    • Method Detail

      • getRunning

        public boolean getRunning()
        Getter for the running field.
        Specified by:
        getRunning in interface ClientOrServer
        Returns:
        boolean which specifies if this Server should be running. Used in shutdown methods.

      • getPeerList

        public java.util.List<Peer> getPeerList()
        Getter for the peerList field.
        Returns:
        a list of peers connected to the server.

      • getPrinter

        public java.io.PrintStream getPrinter()
        Getter for the printer field.
        Specified by:
        getPrinter in interface ClientOrServer
        Returns:
        the printer for this server. Is either System.out or a silent printer.

      • getRoomList

        public java.util.List<Room> getRoomList()
        Getter for the roomList field.

        a list of all rooms started by this server.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter for the name field. Not really needed as it will always be "server". But used for consistency with the ClientOrServer interface.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface ClientOrServer
        Returns:
        the server's name.
        See Also:

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String s)
        Setter for the name field. Not really needed as it will always be "server". But used for consistency with the ClientOrServer interface.
        Specified by:
        setName in interface ClientOrServer
        Parameters:
        s - The server's new name.
        See Also:
        ClientOrServer

      • newGameRoom

        public GameRoom newGameRoom()
        Method used for creating a new instance of GameRoom, to put peers in and play a game. Its index will be equal to the current size of roomList (thus, one higher than the highest) Then adds it to the list of rooms.
        Returns:
        the GameRoom that was created.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs a while loop until the Server is to be shut down (by checking the "running" field). Loop does the following: Tries to create a new socket by accepting a connection in the server socket. Creates a new peer instance for this connection. Moves the peer to lobby.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendMessageToAll

        public void sendMessageToAll(java.lang.String s)
        Sends a message to all peers in peerList
        Specified by:
        sendMessageToAll in interface ClientOrServer
        Parameters:
        s - The message to send

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Shuts down server by settings the running field of this server and all peers to false. Cloes connections to all peers. Closes the server socket. Closes the terminal input handler.
        Specified by:
        shutDown in interface ClientOrServer
